excursive adjective
(WRITING OR SPEECH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
often moving away from the main subject you are writing or talking about, and writing or talking about something else: She has an excursive mind that leaves nothing unexplored. Long excursive passages interrupt the logical progression of the argument. Synonym
digressive

excursive adjective
(MOVEMENT)
biology
  literary or specialized moving away from the usual place or in many different directions: Then the excursive visitor arrived, who was frequently on the move and spent a restless evening. A few of the dogs exhibited excursive behaviour and travelled more than 500 metres away from their release point.
